meanings.sent1: I will randomize the colors of my drawing to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The computer program will randomize the order of the questions on the quiz.
meanings.sent3: Let's randomize the seating arrangement for the party and see who ends up sitting next to whom!
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to randomize the brush strokes on the canvas, creating a unique and unpredictable pattern.
meanings.sent5: In order to keep the game fair, we need to randomize the selection process for the winner.

meanings.definition: To arrange or select in a random manner.
meanings.sent1: She likes to randomize her playlist so she never knows which song will play next.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will randomize the groups for the project to encourage collaboration.
meanings.sent3: I'm going to randomize my wardrobe selection today and wear whatever I grab first.
meanings.sent4: The chef decided to randomize the ingredients in the dish, resulting in a surprisingly delicious combination.
meanings.sent5: To add an element of surprise, we should randomize the order of the presentations.
